projectPurpose: A personal collection of small coding projects created during the process of learning the Rust programming language, serving as a learning journal and shared examples.
mainFeatures: Collection of small, independent Rust code projects
Demonstrates practical application of Rust concepts
Openly accessible for others to view and learn from

alternatives.name: Rust by Example
mainFeatures: Covers various Rust features and standard library

alternatives.name: Rustlings
mainFeatures: Covers basic to advanced Rust topics
Helps users get familiar with Rust syntax and compiler messages
Integrates with a local Rust environment

alternatives.name: Exercism
alternatives.license: Open Source (AGPL-3.0 for platform, MIT for exercises)
mainFeatures: Coding exercises in numerous languages (including Rust)

marketPositioning: "rust-practice" is positioned as a personal, project-based learning supplement for Rust. Unlike formal documentation or structured interactive courses, it offers a view into an individual's journey of learning Rust through building small, practical code examples. Its value lies in providing diverse, 'real-world' (albeit tiny) project inspirations and demonstrating one learner's approach to applying Rust concepts, rather than serving as a primary, comprehensive, or interactive learning tool.
